Wisdom: امْلِكْ عَلَيْكَ هَوَاكَ وَشُحَّ بِنَفْسِكَ عَمَّا لَا يَحِلُّ لَكَ فَإِنَّ الشُّحَّ بِالنَّفْسِ حَقِيقَةُ الْكَرَمِ
enWisdom: Control your vain desire and be stingy with yourself [by keeping away] from those things that are forbidden for you, for indeed being stingy with oneself is the essence of honour

Wisdom: امْلِكُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ بِدَوَامِ جِهَادِهَا
enWisdom: Gain control over your souls by your continuous struggle against it

Wisdom: اغْلِبُوا أَهْوَاءَكُمْ وَهَارِبُوهَا فَإِنَّهَا إِنْ تُقَيِّدْكُمْ تُورِدْكُمْ مِنَ الْهَلَكَةِ أَبْعَدَ غَايَةٍ
enWisdom: Overcome your vain desires and flee from them, for indeed if they capture you they will take you into the farthest depths of destruction

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ الْجِهَادَ ثَمَنُ الْجَنَّةِ فَمَنْ جَاهَدَ نَفْسَهُ مَلَكَهَا وَهِيَ أَكْرَمُ ثَوَابِ اللَّهِ لِمَنْ عَرَفَهَا
enWisdom: Indeed Jih?d is the price of Paradise, so the one who struggles against his self will acquire it, and this is the greatest reward of Allah for the one who is cognizant of it

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْجِهَادِ مُجَاهَدَةُ الْمَرْءِ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: The best Jih?d is the struggle of a man against his [carnal] soul

Wisdom: أَقْوَى النَّاسِ مَنْ غَلَبَ هَوَاهُ
enWisdom: The strongest person is one who overpowers his vain desires

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ جَاهَدَ هَوَاهُ
enWisdom: The best of people is one who struggles against his vain desire

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْجِهَادِ جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ عَنِ الْهَوَى وَفِطَامُهَا عَنْ لَذَّاتِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: The best Jih?d is the struggle of the self against lustful desires, and its weaning away from the pleasures of this world

Wisdom: آخِرُ مَا تَفْقِدُونَ مُجَاهَدَةُ أَهْوَائِكُمْ وَطَاعَةُ أُولِي الْأَمْرِ مِنْكُمْ
enWisdom: The last things that you [should] lose are: the struggling against your selves and obedience to those who have authority among you

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ مَا تُنْكِرُونَ مِنَ الْجِهَادِ جِهَادُ أَنْفُسِكُمْ
enWisdom: The first thing that you disavow from Jih?d is struggling against your selves

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ الْجِهَادِ مُجَاهَدَةُ الرَّجُلِ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: Indeed the best Jih?d is the struggle of a man against his [carnal] soul

Wisdom: إِنَّ مُجَاهَدَةَ النَّفْسِ لَتَزِمُّهَا عَنِ الْمَعَاصِي وَتَعْصِمُهَا عَنِ الرَّدَى
enWisdom: Verily struggling against the self restrains it from sins and protects it from destruction

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْمُجَاهِدَ نَفْسَهُ عَلَى طَاعَةِ اللَّهِ وَعَنْ مَعَاصِيهِ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ بِمَنْزِلَةِ بَرٍّ شَهِيدٍ
enWisdom: Verily the one who struggles with his [lower] self, in obedience to Allah and against disobedience to Him, has the status of a virtuous martyr in the sight of Allah

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْمُجَاهِدَ نَفْسَهُ وَالْمُغَالِبَ غَضَبَهُ وَالْمُحَافِظَ عَلَى طَاعَةِ رَبِّهِ يَرْفَعُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ لَهُ ثَوَابَ الصَّائِمِ الْقَائِمِ وَيُنِيلُهُ دَرَجَةَ الْمُرَابِطِ الصَّابِرِ
enWisdom: Indeed the one who struggles against his [lower] self, overcomes his anger and is careful in obeying [the commandments of] Allah, is raised by Allah, the Glorified, to the status of the one who fasts by day and stands in prayer by night, and is granted the rank of the patient soldier [who fights in His way]

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ جَاهَدْتَ نَفْسَكَ حُزْتَ رِضَى اللَّهِ
enWisdom: Verily if you struggle against your [lower] self you will obtain the pleasure of Allah

Wisdom: تَجَنَّبْ مِنْ كُلِّ خُلُقٍ أَسْوَأَهُ وَجَاهِدْ نَفْسَكَ عَلَى تَجَنُّبِهِ فَإِنَّ الشَّرَّ لَجَاجَةٌ
enWisdom: Keep away from the worst of every character trait and struggle with yourself in keeping away from it, for indeed evil is obstinate

Wisdom: بِالْمُجَاهَدَةِ صَلَاحُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: Uprightness of the soul is [attained] through struggle

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْمُجَاهَدَةِ قَهْرُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: The fruit of struggle [against the self] is overpowering the self

Wisdom: جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ أَفْضَلُ جِهَادٍ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self is the best Jihad

Wisdom: جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ مَهْرُ الْجَنَّةِ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self is the dowry for Paradise

Wisdom: جِهَادُ الْهَوَى ثَمَنُ الْجَنَّةِ
enWisdom: Struggling against vain desires is the price of Paradise

Wisdom: جَاهِدْ نَفْسَكَ وَقَدِّمْ تَوْبَتَكَ تَفُزْ بِطَاعَةِ رَبِّكَ
enWisdom: Struggle against your [lower] self and seek repentance, you will be successful in the obedience of your Lord

Wisdom: جَاهِدْ شَهْوَتَكَ وَغَالِبْ غَضَبَكَ وَخَالِفْ سُوءَ عَادَتِكَ تَزْكُ نَفْسُكَ وَيَكْمُلْ عَقْلُكَ وَتَسْتَكْمِلْ ثَوَابَ رَبِّكَ
enWisdom: Struggle against your vain desires, overcome your anger and resist your bad habits, [by this] your soul will become pure, your intellect will become perfect and the reward of your Lord will be complete

Wisdom: جَاهِدْ نَفْسَكَ عَلَى طَاعَةِ اللَّهِ مُجَاهَدَةَ الْعَدُوِّ عَدُوَّهُ وَغَالِبْهَا مُغَالَبَةَ الضِّدِّ ضِدَّهُ فَإِنَّ أَقْوَى النَّاسِ مَنْ قَوِيَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: Fight against your [lower] self in obedience to Allah the way an enemy would fight his enemy, and overpower it the way a rival would overpower his opponent, for indeed the strongest person is the one who subdues his self

Wisdom: جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ ثَمَنُ الْجَنَّةِ فَمَنْ جَاهَدَهَا مَلَكَهَا وَهِيَ أَكْرَمُ ثَوَابِ اللَّهِ لِمَنْ عَرَفَهَا
enWisdom: Struggling against the [lower] self is the price of Paradise, so the one who struggles against it will acquire it, and this is the greatest reward of Allah for the one who is cognizant of it

Wisdom: جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ بِالْعِلْمِ عُنْوَانُ الْعَقْلِ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self with knowledge is a symbol of intelligence

Wisdom: حَارِبُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا وَاصْرِفُوهَا عَنْهَا فَإِنَّهَا سَرِيعَةُ الزَّوَالِ كَثِيرَةُ الزِّلْزَالِ وَشِيكَةُ الِانْتِقَالِ
enWisdom: Wage war against yourselves for [keeping away from] this world and turn yourselves away from it, for it vanishes quickly, quakes frequently and transfers soon

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الْجِهَادِ جِهَادُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: The most excellent Jih?d is struggling against the self

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الْعَقْلِ مُجَاهَدَةُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The cornerstone of reason is struggling against vain desire

Wisdom: رَحِمَ اللَّهُ امْرَأً أَقْمَعَ نَوَازِعَ نَفْسِهِ إِلَى الْهَوَى فَصَانَهَا وَقَادَهَا إِلَى طَاعَةِ اللَّهِ بِعِنَانِهَا
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: رَدْعُ الشَّهْوَةِ وَالْغَضَبِ جِهَادُ النُّبَلَاءِ
enWisdom: Inhibiting lust and anger is the struggle of the noble ones

Wisdom: رُدَّ عَنْ [مِنْ‏] نَفْسِكَ عِنْدَ الشَّهَوَاتِ وَأَقِمْهَا عَلَى كِتَابِ اللَّهِ عِنْدَ الشُّبُهَاتِ
enWisdom: Turn your soul away when faced with lustful desires and make it steadfast on the book of Allah when faced with doubts

Wisdom: رَدْعُ النَّفْسِ وَجِهَادُهَا عَنْ أَهْوِيَتِهَا يَرْفَعُ الدَّرَجَاتِ وَيُضَاعِفُ الْحَسَنَاتِ
enWisdom: Restraining the soul and struggling against its vain desires raises one’s ranks and multiplies the good deeds

Wisdom: ضَادُّوا الشَّهْوَةَ بِالْقَمْعِ
enWisdom: Counter lust with restraint

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ غَلَبَ نَفْسَهُ وَلَمْ تَغْلِبْهُ وَمَلَكَ هَوَاهُ وَلَمْ يَمْلِكْهُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: غَايَةُ الْمُجَاهَدَةِ أَنْ يُجَاهِدَ الْمَرْءُ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: The highest form of struggle is for a man to struggle against his self

Wisdom: غَالِبُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَلَى تَرْكِ الْمَعَاصِي تَسْهُلْ عَلَيْكُمْ مَقَادَتُهَا إِلَى الطَّاعَاتِ
enWisdom: Compel your souls to abandon acts of disobedience and it will become easier for you to lead them towards acts of obedience [and worship]

Wisdom: غَالِبُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَلَى تَرْكِ الْعَادَاتِ تَغْلِبُوهَا وَجَاهِدُوا أَهْوَاءَكُمْ تَمْلِكُوهَا
enWisdom: Compel your souls to abandon bad habits and you will overcome them; fight against your vain desires and you will gain control over them

Wisdom: فِي مُجَاهَدَةِ النَّفْسِ كَمَالُ الصَّلَاحِ
enWisdom: Perfection of righteousness is in struggling against the [carnal] soul

Wisdom: قُدْرَتُكَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ أَفْضَلُ الْقُدْرَةِ وَإِمْرَتُكَ عَلَيْهَا خَيْرُ الْإِمْرَةِ
enWisdom: Your power over your soul is the best power and your authority over it is the best authority

Wisdom: قَاوِمِ الشَّهْوَةَ بِالْقَمْعِ لَهَا تَظْفَرْ
enWisdom: Resist lust by subduing it and you will be victorious

Wisdom: كَفَاكَ فِي مُجَاهَدَةِ نَفْسِكَ أَنْ لَا تَزَالَ أَبَداً لَهَا مُغَالِباً وَعَلَى أَهْوِيَتِهَا مُحَارِباً
enWisdom: It is sufficient for you, in your struggle against your [lower] self, that you always prevail over it and fight its vain desires

Wisdom: لَنْ يَحُوزَ الْجَنَّةَ إِلَّا مَنْ جَاهَدَ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: None shall attain Paradise except the one who struggles against his [lower] self

Wisdom: مَنْ جَاهَدَ نَفْسَهُ أَكْمَلَ التُّقَى
enWisdom: One who fights his [lower] self perfects his piety

Wisdom: مَنْ عَصَى نَفْسَهُ وَصَلَهَا
enWisdom: Whoever disobeys his soul has awarded it

Wisdom: مَنْ مَلَكَ نَفْسَهُ عَلَا أَمْرُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever controls his [carnal] soul, his affair [and status] is elevated

Wisdom: مَنْ مَقَتَ نَفْسَهُ أَحَبَّهُ اللَّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever loathes his [carnal] soul is loved by Allah

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُجَاهِدْ نَفْسَهُ لَمْ يَنَلِ الْفَوْزَ
enWisdom: One who does not struggle against his self will not achieve victory

Wisdom: مَنْ خَالَفَ نَفْسَهُ فَقَدْ غَلَبَ الشَّيْطَانَ [هَوَاهُ‏]
enWisdom: Whoever opposes his [carnal] soul has indeed defeated Satan

Wisdom: مَا مِنْ جِهَادٍ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ جِهَادِ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: There is no struggle more worthy than struggling against the self

Wisdom: مُجَاهَدَةُ النَّفْسِ شِيمَةُ النُّبَلَاءِ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self is a trait of the noble ones

Wisdom: مُجَاهَدَةُ النَّفْسِ عُنْوَانُ النُّبْلِ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self is a symbol of nobility

Wisdom: مُجَاهَدَةُ النَّفْسِ أَفْضَلُ جِهَادٍ
enWisdom: Struggling against the self is the best Jih?d

Wisdom: لَا تَحْلُمْ عَنْ نَفْسِكَ إِذَا هِيَ أَغْوَتْكَ
enWisdom: Do not be lenient with your [carnal] soul when it entices you

Wisdom: لَا جِهَادَ [لَا اجْتِهَادَ] كَجِهَادِ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: There is no Jih?d like struggle against the self
